com.serena.dmclient.api
Interface DimensionsConnection

public interface DimensionsConnection

This interface represents a connection from a client to a Dimensions server. It has methods for retrieving the state of this connection and the type of license associated with this connection. The interface also provides access to a DimensionsObjectFactory object that can be used for querying data via this connection.

Serena recommends that clients do not open multiple concurrent connections to the same server using the same user ID, as this will monopolise server resources.

A note on connection durability

Persistent connection loss is only likely to occur if either the server is down or if the physical connection between client and server has been broken. In those circumstances, either a DimensionsNetworkException will be thrown or you will get unexpected results from API methods. In this case, to be absolutely sure the server is unavailable, consumers should call DimensionsConnection.getConnection(true), which will cause dmclient to ping the server. If it returns anything other than DimensionsConnection.STATE_CONNECTED, either the server is unavailable or the session has expired, so your code should behave accordingly.

If a SessionExpiredException is thrown, it will not be possible to reestablish the connection using the existing instance of DimensionsConnection, a new connection will need to be established by the consumer using a new DimensionsConnection instance. (this may not be available, depends on dmnet's ability to report it) If a DimensionsNetworkException is thrown, consumers should take the following course of action;
1/ retry the call that caused the failure. If that still fails then
2/ discard the current connection and attempt to establish a new one using the usual method. If that fails then
3/ the server must be unavailable, so fail
Things that can go wrong:
1/ network loss, server down - either DNE or unpredictable behaviour
2/ session expiry - either DNE or SEE

Field Summary
static int LICENSE_DIMENSIONS
          A full Dimensions license.
static int LICENSE_DIMENSIONS_CHANGE
          A change-only (issue-only) Dimensions license.
static int LICENSE_NONE
          Represents the absence of a Dimensions license.
static int STATE_CLOSED
          The connection state after the connection to Dimensions is closed.
static int STATE_CONNECTED
          The connection state after the connection to Dimensions is established and is active, and the connection has not reached any server timeouts.
static int STATE_EXPIRED
          The connection state after the connection to Dimensions is established but has been inactive for a period of time and the server-side session has expired causing any server-side state has been lost.

          Retrieves an instance of DimensionsObjectFactory.
 void initialise()
          Performs initialisation tasks for this connection.
 void reinitialise()
          Reinitialises certain cached data associated with this connection, without causing the connection to be closed, or re-opened.
 

Field Detail

STATE_CLOSED

static final int STATE_CLOSED
The connection state after the connection to Dimensions is closed. Once the connection is in this state it cannot be "reopened".

See Also:
getConnectionState(boolean), Constant Field Values

STATE_CONNECTED

static final int STATE_CONNECTED
The connection state after the connection to Dimensions is established and is active, and the connection has not reached any server timeouts.

See Also:
getConnectionState(boolean), Constant Field Values

STATE_EXPIRED

static final int STATE_EXPIRED
The connection state after the connection to Dimensions is established but has been inactive for a period of time and the server-side session has expired causing any server-side state has been lost. The connection cannot be re-established from this state and ceases to be of practical use.

See Also:
getConnectionState(boolean), Constant Field Values

LICENSE_NONE

static final int LICENSE_NONE
Represents the absence of a Dimensions license. Do not use this field to request a license, it is used to return value for getLicenseType().

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LICENSE_DIMENSIONS

static final int LICENSE_DIMENSIONS
A full Dimensions license.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LICENSE_DIMENSIONS_CHANGE

static final int LICENSE_DIMENSIONS_CHANGE
A change-only (issue-only) Dimensions license.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getConnectionState

int getConnectionState(boolean reconnectIfIdle)
Finds the status of the connection to the Dimensions server.

This meis not a cheap operation and may re-establish the network connection to the server (if the argument reconnect is true). The connection state of STATE_EXPIRED will only be returned after calling this with reconnect set to true. Otherwise, it will appear as STATE_IDLE.

Parameters:
reconnectIfIdle - whether to attempt to connect to Dimensions if disconnected (required to distinguish between STATE_IDLE and STATE_EXPIRED).
Returns:
the state of the connection to the Dimensions server.
See Also:
STATE_CLOSED, STATE_CONNECTED, STATE_EXPIRED

getLicenseType

int getLicenseType()
Finds the type of license that was checked out during login.

Returns:
the license type.
See Also:
LICENSE_DIMENSIONS, LICENSE_DIMENSIONS_CHANGE

getCharEncoding

java.lang.String getCharEncoding()
Returns the character Encoding of the underlying connection.

Returns:
the character encoding - UTF-8 returned if server is UTF-8

getObjectFactory

DimensionsObjectFactory getObjectFactory()
Retrieves an instance of DimensionsObjectFactory. A DimensionsObjectFactory is used for creating new Dimensions objects and for retrieving existing ones, and needs to be associated with a connection to a Dimensions server.

Returns:
a factory object that is hooked up to this connection; this may be an existing factory instance if someone has already retrieved a factory for this connection.
See Also:
DimensionsObjectFactory

getConnectionDetails

DimensionsConnectionDetails getConnectionDetails()
Return the DimensionsConnectionDetails details instance used to create this connection.

Returns:
the details instance that can be used to duplicate this connection.
See Also:
DimensionsConnectionManager.getConnection(DimensionsConnectionDetails)

close

void close()
Terminates the connection to Dimensions and puts this connection into the STATE_CLOSED state.

See Also:
STATE_CLOSED, getConnectionState(boolean)

initialise

void initialise()
Performs initialisation tasks for this connection.

It is not mandatory to call this method before using this connection, but performance improvements may be experienced subsequent to calling it. Note that this is a potentially expensive operation.

There is no restriction on the number of times this method may be called.

reinitialise

void reinitialise()
Reinitialises certain cached data associated with this connection, without causing the connection to be closed, or re-opened.

Calling this method is always an expensive operation.

There is no restriction on the number of times this method may be called.
